Why the hell is this index page not the one shown on localhost:/8000? Why is there another index page in the output folder? Why is that other index page served instead? How can I replace the automatically-generated index page with my one?

Okay, after changing to INDEX_PATH="blog" in conf.py, Nikola now puts the offending index.html page away in the blog folder. However, the index page that I want to be the home page is still not in the root of the output folder, so is not served.

Okay, fixed.

The home page of any website seems to be index.html. So you need an index.html in the root directory of the output folder.

I created a 'home' subfolder in the stories folder. The conf.py file has a PAGES = ( (a bunch of tuples) ) line. I added ("stories/home/*.rst", "", "stories.tmpl") to that line. This makes .rst files in the home folder be processed and end up in the "" folder, ie. in the root of the output folder.

Now it works.
